intro: Bourreria cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf burrhead, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers.
